task.title: Declare and Use Variables
task.problemStatement: Create a program that declares variables for storing a person's name, age, and email address. Assign appropriate values to each variable and display them in a formatted output.

challenges.title: Multiple Variable Declarations
challenges.description: Declare 5 different variables using var, let, and const and log them all

challenges.title: Variable Reassignment
challenges.description: Create a variable, assign it a value, then reassign it to a different value and display both

challenges.title: Variable Naming Convention
challenges.description: Practice using camelCase naming convention for multiple variables

task.title: Working with Constants
task.problemStatement: Define constants for mathematical values (PI, E) and application settings. Try to understand why constants are important for values that should not change.

challenges.title: Constant vs Variable
challenges.description: Compare const and let by attempting to reassign a const and observing the error

challenges.title: Object Constants
challenges.description: Create a const object and modify its properties (showing immutability vs property mutability)

challenges.title: Array Constants
challenges.description: Create a const array and add/remove elements to understand const behavior with mutable objects

task.title: Identify and Use Datatypes
task.problemStatement: Create variables of different JavaScript datatypes: string, number, boolean, null, undefined, object, and symbol. Log each variable with its type using typeof operator.
task.expectedOutput:
string: "Hello" - type: string
number: 42 - type: number
boolean: true - type: boolean
null: null - type: object
undefined: undefined - type: undefined

challenges.title: Type Checking
challenges.description: Create a function that accepts different datatypes and returns their type

challenges.title: Datatype Conversion
challenges.description: Convert between different datatypes (string to number, number to boolean, etc.)

challenges.title: typeof vs instanceof
challenges.description: Demonstrate the difference between typeof and instanceof operators

task.title: Understand Dynamic Typing
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate dynamic typing by creating a variable and assigning it different datatypes in sequence. Log the variable and its type after each assignment to show how JavaScript allows type changes.
task.expectedOutput:
Initial: 10, Type: number
After reassignment: "Hello", Type: string
After reassignment: true, Type: boolean

challenges.title: Type Coercion
challenges.description: Show examples of implicit type coercion in JavaScript operations

challenges.title: Comparison Operators
challenges.description: Demonstrate loose equality (==) vs strict equality (===) with different types

challenges.title: Dynamic Behavior
challenges.description: Create a function that processes the same variable when it has different types

task.title: Create and Manipulate Objects
task.problemStatement: Create a student object with properties for name, rollNumber, grade, and courses array. Add methods to calculate GPA and display student information.
task.expectedOutput:
Student: John, Roll: 101, Grade: A
Courses: JavaScript, React, Node.js
GPA: 3.8

challenges.title: Object Methods
challenges.description: Add multiple methods to the object and invoke them with proper context

challenges.title: Nested Objects
challenges.description: Create objects with nested properties and access deeply nested values

challenges.title: Object Iteration
challenges.description: Iterate through object properties using for-in, Object.keys(), and Object.entries()

task.title: Working with Arrays
task.problemStatement: Create an array of numbers and perform operations like adding elements, removing elements, finding maximum/minimum values, and calculating the sum of all elements.
task.expectedOutput:
Original: [1, 5, 3, 9, 2]
After adding 7: [1, 5, 3, 9, 2, 7]
Max: 9, Min: 1, Sum: 27

challenges.title: Array Methods
challenges.description: Use map, filter, reduce, and forEach to manipulate arrays

challenges.title: Array Transformation
challenges.description: Transform an array of objects (students) and extract specific properties

challenges.title: Multi-dimensional Arrays
challenges.description: Create and manipulate a 2D array (matrix) and access nested elements

task.title: Define and Use Functions
task.problemStatement: Create functions to calculate area of circle, rectangle, and triangle. Each function should accept parameters and return the calculated area. Also create a main function that calls all these functions.
task.expectedOutput:
Circle area (r=5): 78.5
Rectangle area (l=4, w=6): 24
Triangle area (b=5, h=8): 20

challenges.title: Function Expressions
challenges.description: Rewrite function declarations as function expressions and arrow functions

challenges.title: Higher Order Functions
challenges.description: Create functions that return functions or accept functions as parameters

challenges.title: Recursion
challenges.description: Write recursive functions to calculate factorial or Fibonacci number

task.title: Perform Arithmetic Operations
task.problemStatement: Create a calculator program that demonstrates all arithmetic operators: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, modulus, and exponentiation. Show results for various number combinations.

challenges.title: Order of Operations
challenges.description: Demonstrate operator precedence with complex expressions

challenges.title: Increment and Decrement
challenges.description: Show differences between pre-increment (++x) and post-increment (x++)

challenges.title: Mathematical Expressions
challenges.description: Solve complex mathematical formulas using arithmetic operators

task.title: Master Arithmetic Operations
task.problemStatement: Build a utility that takes two numbers and performs all arithmetic operations. Handle edge cases like division by zero and ensure accurate calculations with proper formatting.
task.expectedOutput:
Results for a=20, b=3:
Addition: 23
Subtraction: 17
Multiplication: 60
Division: 6.67
Modulus: 2

challenges.title: Compound Assignment
challenges.description: Use +=, -=, *=, /= operators in calculations

challenges.title: Number Precision
challenges.description: Handle floating-point precision issues in arithmetic operations

challenges.title: String to Number Conversion
challenges.description: Convert string inputs to numbers and perform arithmetic operations

task.title: Use Assignment Operators
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate all assignment operators (=, +=, -=, *=, /=, %=, **=) with practical examples. Show how compound assignment operators modify variables efficiently.
task.expectedOutput:
Initial value: 10
After += 5: 15
After -= 3: 12
After *= 2: 24
After /= 4: 6
After %= 4: 2

challenges.title: Variable Updates
challenges.description: Create a system where variables are updated multiple times with different assignment operators

challenges.title: Destructuring Assignment
challenges.description: Use destructuring assignment with arrays and objects

challenges.title: Spread Operator
challenges.description: Understand and use the spread operator with assignment

task.title: Compare Values with Comparison Operators
task.problemStatement: Create a comparison utility that demonstrates all comparison operators (>, <, >=, <=) with different datatypes. Show results as true/false for various comparisons.

challenges.title: Type Comparison
challenges.description: Compare values of different types (string vs number) and understand type coercion

challenges.title: Null and Undefined
challenges.description: Compare null and undefined with various values

challenges.title: String Comparison
challenges.description: Understand lexicographic ordering in string comparisons

task.title: Understand Equality Operators
task.problemStatement: Compare loose equality (==) and strict equality (===) operators with various values. Show how == performs type coercion while === checks both value and type.
task.expectedOutput:
5 == '5': true (loose equality with type coercion)
5 === '5': false (strict equality, different types)
Null == undefined: true
Null === undefined: false

challenges.title: Inequality Operators
challenges.description: Demonstrate != vs !== operators with practical examples

challenges.title: Object Equality
challenges.description: Compare object references and understand reference equality

challenges.title: Array Comparison
challenges.description: Show why two arrays with same elements are not equal using == or ===

task.title: Use Ternary Operator for Conditional Logic
task.problemStatement: Replace if-else statements with ternary operators in practical scenarios. Create functions that determine grade based on marks, eligibility based on age, and discount based on purchase amount.
task.expectedOutput:
Score 85: Grade A
Age 25: Eligible
Amount 5000: Discount 10%

challenges.title: Nested Ternary
challenges.description: Use nested ternary operators for multiple conditions (while keeping code readable)

challenges.title: Ternary with Functions
challenges.description: Return different functions using ternary operator

challenges.title: Assignment with Ternary
challenges.description: Assign values to variables using ternary operator based on conditions

task.title: Work with Logical Operators
task.problemStatement: Create a program that uses logical operators (AND, OR, NOT) to validate user input. Check if age is between 18-60, if email contains '@', and if password length is >= 8 characters.
task.expectedOutput:
Age (25) in range: true
Email valid: true
Password strong: true
All conditions met: true

challenges.title: Operator Precedence
challenges.description: Demonstrate how AND has higher precedence than OR

challenges.title: Short-circuit Evaluation
challenges.description: Show how logical operators short-circuit (stop evaluating when result is determined)

challenges.title: Complex Logic
challenges.description: Build complex validation logic combining multiple logical operators

title: JavaScript Logical Operator with Non Boolean Values

task.title: Logical Operators with Truthy and Falsy Values
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate how logical operators work with truthy and falsy values. Show how AND returns the first falsy value or the last value, and how OR returns the first truthy value.

challenges.title: Default Values
challenges.description: Use || operator to provide default values for undefined or null variables

challenges.title: Nullish Coalescing
challenges.description: Use ?? operator to distinguish between null/undefined and falsy values

challenges.title: Logical Assignment
challenges.description: Use &&=, ||=, and ??= operators for conditional assignment

task.title: Perform Bitwise Operations
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate bitwise operators (AND, OR, XOR, NOT, left shift, right shift) with binary representations. Show how these operators work at the bit level for optimization.

challenges.title: Binary Representation
challenges.description: Convert numbers to binary and explain bitwise operation results

challenges.title: Bit Manipulation
challenges.description: Check if specific bits are set, toggle bits, or clear bits using bitwise operators

challenges.title: Performance Optimization
challenges.description: Use bitwise operations for flags or efficient calculations

task.title: Understand Operator Precedence and Associativity
task.problemStatement: Create expressions that demonstrate operator precedence. Show how multiplication is evaluated before addition, how exponentiation is right-associative, and how parentheses override precedence.

challenges.title: Complex Expressions
challenges.description: Build complex expressions and predict results using precedence rules

challenges.title: Logical Operator Precedence
challenges.description: Understand precedence of AND, OR, and NOT operators

challenges.title: Associativity Rules
challenges.description: Demonstrate left-associative and right-associative operators

task.title: Control Flow with If-Else Statements
task.problemStatement: Create a program that evaluates student performance using if-else statements. Assign grades (A: >=90, B: >=80, C: >=70, D: >=60, F: <60) based on marks and provide feedback for each grade.
task.expectedOutput:
Marks: 85
Grade: B
Feedback: Good performance, aim for A grade next time

challenges.title: Nested If-Else
challenges.description: Use nested if-else for complex multi-level conditions

challenges.title: Switch Statement
challenges.description: Convert if-else logic to switch-case statement

challenges.title: Early Return
challenges.description: Use early returns in functions to simplify complex if-else chains
